Body:
I am trying to connect TI SensorTag to the IBM Internet of Things. I connected BeagleBone to linux and and I logged in into BeagleBone in following way. ssh root@192.168.7.2

But I am not sure how to get the mac address ? Can someone please help me in this?

Diwesh you need to get the device id while registering the sensor tag ...

please follow these steps to connect your sensor tag:

ssh root@192.168.7.2

ifconfig eth0

your will see something like this :

Link encap:Ethernet HWaddr 09:00:12:90:e3:e5 .......

HWaddr will be your mac address.
Thanks Manish, it solved my problem.

You can get your deviceâ€™s media access control (MAC) address,which needs to be entered json file while registering sensor tag.

Below is the reference link which may help you on developing app:

http://thoughtsoncloud.com/2014/10/internet-things-iot-ibm-bluemix-growth-innovation/

https://developer.ibm.com/bluemix/2014/07/16/bluemix-internet-things/
